meanings.definition: A thing used to make something look more attractive.
meanings.sent1: She wore a shiny ornament in her hair.
meanings.sent2: The Christmas tree was covered in colorful ornaments.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the ornament was a toy and batted at it playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright ornament in the room.
meanings.sent5: The ornament sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: To make something look more attractive by adding decorative items.
meanings.sent1: She decided to ornament the cake with edible flowers.
meanings.sent2: The artist used paint to ornament the walls of the gallery.
meanings.sent3: He tried to ornament his speech with fancy words, but it sounded unnatural.
meanings.sent4: The garden was ornamented with beautiful statues and fountains.
meanings.sent5: The costume designer ornamented the dress with intricate beadwork.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that adds beauty to something.
meanings.sent1: She was like an ornament to the group, always bringing joy.
meanings.sent2: The old clock was a cherished family ornament.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was an unexpected ornament to the picnic.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was an ornament to the solemn occasion.
meanings.sent5: The rare flower was an exquisite ornament to the garden.
